image.altText: A person in hi-vis vest directing a police van next to other police vehicles near a train station

props.synopsis: SA Police say 72 people were arrested and 10 were reported for offences overnight across the state.

title.children: Girl, 12, stabbed and police officers allegedly assaulted in separate Adelaide incidents

image.altText: A man in a patterned shirt leans back on a red and silver Jeep with the Jurassic Park logo on the car door

props.synopsis: Zakary Weyer's obsession with Jurassic Park drove him to learn different skills to build a replica of the Jeep that appears in the iconic blockbuster.

title.children: Jurassic Park fan fulfils childhood dream of recreating Jeep

image.altText: Adelaide Strikers batter Chris Lynn looks over his shoulder after a shot in a Big Bash League game against Brisbane Heat.

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane star Chris Lynn clobbers the Adelaide Strikers to an easy victory over the Heat in the New Year's Eve Big Bash League clash.

title.children: Lynn's fireworks get Strikers over the line in NYE clash for first time since 2018

image.altText: A man sitting on a 95-year-old harvester.

props.synopsis: While most farmers search for the newest technology to help with harvest, Leigh Baker has worked to bring a 95-year-old piece of equipment back to life.

title.children: Farmer restores 95-year-old vintage harvester and puts it to work

image.altText: Spectacular colourful fireworks over Sydney Harbour

props.synopsis: Revellers welcomed 2026 at various sites across Australia's major cities, including Sydney, where there was a heavy police presence in the wake of the Bondi terror attack earlier this month.

title.children: NYE fireworks light up cities across Australia amid heightened security

image.altText: Chef cooking beef with China and Australian flags in the background

props.synopsis: Meat Industry Council says it is "extremely disappointed" as China imposes a tariff on Australian beef imports that could cost $1 billion.

title.children: Australian meat body warns new China beef tariff impact will be 'severe'

image.altText: Katie Wahlheim sits with two border collie dogs, as one looks up with his snout very close to her face

props.synopsis: Within 20 minutes of leaving an Adelaide beach dogs Lucy and Ella began breathing rapidly and fell "terribly sick", prompting their owner to issue a warning.

title.children: Pet owner's warning as dog left 'frothing' after SA beach visit

image.altText: An orange old fashioned car on a road

props.synopsis: Despite becoming unofficial several years ago, a community-driven event has attracted about 1,000 drivers and even more spectators in Adelaide.

title.children: Car culture rolling strong in Adelaide as unofficial event attracts thousands

image.altText: Darren standing in his backyard, clutching at the net which covers his fruit free.

props.synopsis: There was no fruit fly to be found in Broken Hill 20 years ago, but now gardeners are facing an uphill battle trying to rid themselves of the pest.

title.children: Outback gardeners continue 20-year battle with destructive fruit pest

image.altText: A young boy with golden curly hair smiles as he sits by a table with playing sand

props.synopsis: As 2025 draws to a close and we look back at the stories that made headlines, for South Australians the year could be summarised as one where we searched for answers, with little results.

title.children: A year SA searched for answers, but came up short

image.altText: A woman floating in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: Half a century after the first nude beach opened in Australia, these naturists say they are still fighting to keep beaches open and misconceptions at bay.

title.children: Stripping away misconceptions and fighting for nude beaches

image.altText: A glass sculture with a tall, light blue patterned base and a purple bowl on top.

props.synopsis: The art of glassblowing was popularised in a recent reality TV series, but these Australian artists are forging their own paths in the creative process of sculpting this tricky medium.

title.children: Meet the young artists pushing the boundaries of glassmaking

image.altText: outback drone

props.synopsis: It's more than 1,000km from any capital city, but Cameron Corner, at the junction of the NSW, Queensland and South Australian borders, reckons it has one of the best New Year's Eve parties going around because it is a triple celebration over three time zones.

title.children: Outback revellers celebrate three New Year's Eves in one night

image.altText: Fireworks explode and confetti fills the air as a TV reads "Happy New Year 2026"

props.synopsis: Cities around the world have rung in the new year in spectacular style, with fireworks lighting up famous landmarks from the London Eye to Egypt's pyramids.

title.children: New York City rings in new year with famous ball drop

image.altText: Amy Taylor flips the bird wearing black negligee and a white fluffy veil with topiary in the background.

props.synopsis: Punk rocker Amy Taylor has filed a lawsuit against an American photographer, alleging that photos taken for a magazine photo shoot are being sold against her wishes and without her permission.

title.children: Amyl and the Sniffers singer sues photographer over fine art prints

image.altText: Danielle from NewJeans wearing a red bandana over long blond hair, light eyes

props.synopsis: An Australian K-pop idol caught up in a bitter dispute with her former record label is sued for more than $44 million and dropped from her group.

title.children: Australian K-pop idol Danielle dropped from NewJeans and sued by label

image.altText: A woman wearing Somaliland colours

props.synopsis: Israel, suffering international isolation, has recognised a small territory desperate for international attention. Here's why it has caused an enormous stir.

title.children: Why Israel's recognition of Somaliland is considered controversial

image.altText: A police mug shot of a woman.

props.synopsis: Jean Lee and her two co-accused were executed for murder in 1950. Handwritten letters from the trio are among items publicly available for the first time since their trial captured the nation's attention.

title.children: Case file of last woman hanged in Australia released after 75 years

image.altText: A close up of Zohran Mandani raising his right hand as he takes an oath

props.synopsis: Zohran Mamdani is officially sworn in as major of New York City in a midnight, underground ceremony, with a more public affair to take place in hours time on the steps of City Hall.

title.children: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC mayor with midnight subway oath

image.altText: A close up image of donald trump speaking at the wihte house

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says his administration is removing the National Guard from Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland, but added federal forces will "come back" if crime rates go up.

title.children: Trump says National Guard to be pulled from Chicago, LA and Portland

image.altText: A man wearing a helmet while looking out the door of a helicopter which is flying over tsuanmi-devastated land

props.synopsis: From expectations of a trade union backlash against controversial industrial relations reform, to concerns about "homegrown" extremism in Australia, here are what previously unseen cabinet documents tell us about Australian politics in 2005.

title.children: Cabinet papers offer insight into reforms that proved politically fatal for John Howard

image.altText: Lauren Boebert speaks at a conference.

props.synopsis: A month after Donald Trump's spectacular falling-out with MAGA firebrand Marjorie Taylor Greene, another Republican congresswoman publicly lashes out at the US president.

title.children: Trump clashes with another Republican congresswoman

image.altText: A large military drone crashed in snow.

props.synopsis: Moscow's allegation that Ukraine launched an attack on the Russian president's state residence is being dismissed as a ploy to derail peace talks.

title.children: Scepticism as Russia claims video proves Ukrainian drone attack on Putin residence

image.altText: A man and a woman bump bellies together.

props.synopsis: When Lorin Clarke asked her father, satirist John Clarke, if she could start recording their conversations, she thought it would just be for them. But when he tragically died aged 68, one year after the recordings began, Lorin felt his story belonged to more than just her.

title.children: Lorin's father John Clarke had a story to tell, so she recorded their conversations

image.altText: Pat Cummins moves to high-10 fellow Australia bowler Josh Hazlewood during the ODI Cricket World Cup.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David are all included in Australia's 15-player squad for next month's men's Twenty20 World Cup in Sri Lanka and India.

title.children: Injury-hit trio named in Australia's squad for T20 World Cup

image.altText: A public toilet block with timber slats and a concrete wall

props.synopsis: A southern Tasmanian man aged in his 20s is charged after allegedly using a concealed video recording device to film a woman using a public toilet on New Year's Eve.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly filming woman with concealed camera in public toilet

image.altText: A large crowds gathered around a stage with pyrotechnics at a music festival.

props.synopsis: A pill testing trial has been expanded to Sydney's Field Day music festival, but authorities are urging partygoers not to be complacent.

title.children: Drug warning as revellers head to NYD Sydney music festival

image.altText: An intense inferno comes very close to a property pictured at night

props.synopsis: A man has faced court after allegedly sparking an emergency-level bushfire in the Perth Hills that left thousands of people without power and threatened lives and homes.

title.children: 'Catastrophic event': Man who allegedly started New Year's Day fire faces court

image.altText: A holiday snap of Jo Needham holding a takeaway coffee cup on a train travelling past scenery.

props.synopsis: Jo Needham was halfway through a "bucket list" trip across South America when she was flung from her seat on a train near the ancient tourist site of Machu Picchu.

title.children: Gold Coast woman recounts Machu Picchu train crash

image.altText: aerial drone shot of floodwaters cutting off dirt road, car parked at edge of water

props.synopsis: Outback towns remain cut off, and floodwaters are expected to linger in the north-west for weeks. Graziers have started to assess their properties and count stock losses.

title.children: Stranded travellers welcome new year in the bush as floods cut roads

image.altText: A man in combat uniform lying down, and holding a cigarette in one hand.

props.synopsis: Russell Allan Wilson, who spent several years fighting for Ukraine, has been remembered as someone who "gave his life so others could keep theirs".

title.children: Australian soldier fighting for Ukraine 'killed week before wedding'

image.altText: A close up of a Māori man, black hair, tanned, beard stubble, wearing black singlet as he looks out on the ocean.

props.synopsis: Shalom Kaa used to think running was something other people did. But after a series of events that left him at his lowest, running became a big part of his recovery following years of substance abuse with crystal methamphetamines.

title.children: How running helped Shalom overcome years of substance abuse

image.altText: An Australian snowboarder in the air above a wall with the Olympic rings logo on it during a final.

props.synopsis: Fully-fit Australian snowboard medallist Tess Coady is looking forward to competing in the Winter Olympics next month in Italy after a torrid run with injury.

title.children: Aussie Coady fit and firing in time for Italy Winter Olympics

image.altText: A man being helped out of a vehicle by an officer in camo while a crowd of people film.

props.synopsis: British former world heavyweight boxing champion Anthony Joshua is discharged from hospital days after a car accident that killed two of his close friends.

title.children: Boxer Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after car crash
